data.title: Bommanahalli Metro Station Information, Map And Routes
data.meta_description: Bommanahalli Metro Station informations, timeline, platform, facilities and entry /exit points. Get all the details about Namma Metro Stations across Bengaluru.
data.text:
Bommanahalli Metro Station is set to open its doors by December 2024. Nestled on the North-South corridor of the yellow line of Namma Metro, this upcoming elevated station will revolutionize daily commute for residents of South Bangalore.

Once open for commuters, you can board a train heading towards RV Metro Station or head to Bommasandra. The Bommanahalli Metro Station is between Hongansandra and Central Silk Board Metro Station on the yellow line towards RV Road. If you need to change lines, no worries! Simply switch at Jayadeva Hospital for the Pink Line or at RV Road for the Green Line, offering you unparalleled flexibility and connectivity across the city. After Blue line’s construction commuters will be able to interchange at the next Central Silk Board metro station.

Strategically located near key landmarks like the bustling Bommanahalli bus stop and the vibrant Roopeena Agrahara locality, the station provides a smooth transition for public transport commuters. Whether you prefer auto-rickshaws, taxis, or buses, you’ll find it easy to switch between different modes of transport, ensuring a seamless journey to your final destination.

Foodies are in for a treat too. Once the Yellow Line is operational, the area around Bommanahalli Metro Station will become a go-to spot for delicious dining. With popular eateries like Tharavadu Family Restaurant, The Bihari Rasoi, Udupi Grand, Al Khaja Restaurant, and Tikka Kebab Xpress all within a kilometer, there’s something to satisfy every craving and all within 1 km.

Residential areas nearby, such as Golden Lake View Apartment in Roopena Agrahara and Sharavati Residential Apartments, will find this new station a boon. For family outings, the beautiful Madiwala Lake and BDA Park are just within 4 km, perfect for a relaxing evening. If you’re in the mood for some spiritual time, the Lakshmi Narayana Temple and Om Shakthi Temple are just a short walk away. And for your shopping needs, Vishal Mega Mart is only a 10-minute walk, covering all your basic necessities.

With fare ranging from Rs. 10 to Rs. 60, and trains running from 5 am to 11 pm, it caters to both early risers and night owls. While details about parking, feeder buses, and restrooms are still being finalized, the promise of enhanced connectivity and convenience is clear.
